subject: history
title: Governor-Generals & Viceroys of India - Quick Reference
description: Key administrators and their major policies/events

rows.name:
**Warren Hastings**

1773-1785
rows.title: First Governor-General of Bengal
rows.majorEvents:
• Regulating Act 1773 (first GG appointed)
• Rohilla War (1774)
• First Anglo-Maratha War (1775-82)
• Second Anglo-Mysore War (1780-84)
• Founded Asiatic Society of Bengal (1784)
• Impeachment trial in England (1788-95)
rows.examPoints:
**FIRST Governor-General**

Regulating Act 1773

Dual Government ended

Impeached (acquitted)

rows.name:
**Lord Cornwallis**

1786-1793

1805 (2nd term, died)
rows.title: Governor-General
rows.majorEvents:
• Permanent Settlement (1793) - Bengal land revenue
• Cornwallis Code (1793) - civil service reforms
• Third Anglo-Mysore War (1790-92) - Tipu defeated
• Police system reorganized
• Separation of judiciary from executive
rows.examPoints:
**Permanent Settlement 1793**

Cornwallis Code

Tipu defeated

Civil service reforms

rows.name:
**Lord Wellesley**

1798-1805
rows.title: Governor-General
rows.majorEvents:
• Subsidiary Alliance System (1798)
• Fourth Anglo-Mysore War (1799) - Tipu killed
• Second Anglo-Maratha War (1803-05)
• Expanded British territory massively
• Fort William College founded (1800)
rows.examPoints:
**Subsidiary Alliance**

Tipu Sultan killed (1799)

Expansionist policy

'Napoleon of India'

rows.name:
**Lord Dalhousie**

1848-1856
rows.title: Governor-General
rows.majorEvents:
• **Doctrine of Lapse** - annexed Satara, Jhansi, Nagpur, etc.
• Awadh annexed (1856) - on grounds of misrule
• Second Anglo-Sikh War (1848-49) - Punjab annexed
• Railways introduced (1853)
• Telegraph, postal reforms
• Widow Remarriage Act (1856)
• Wood's Despatch on Education (1854)
rows.examPoints:
**Doctrine of Lapse**

Awadh annexation (1856)

Punjab annexed

Railways, Telegraph

→ Led to 1857 Revolt

rows.name:
**Lord Canning**

1856-1862
rows.title:
Last GG

First Viceroy (1858)
rows.majorEvents:
• Revolt of 1857 occurred during his tenure
• Suppressed revolt
• Government of India Act 1858 - Company rule ended
• Became first Viceroy (Queen's rule began)
• Indian Councils Act 1861
• Called 'Clemency Canning' for lenient post-revolt policy
rows.examPoints:
**Last GG, First Viceroy**

1857 Revolt during tenure

Crown rule began (1858)

Clemency Canning

rows.name:
**Lord Ripon**

1880-1884
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Local Self-Government Resolution (1882) - 'Father of Local Self-Govt'
• First Factory Act (1881)
• Ilbert Bill controversy (1883) - failed
• First regular Census (1881)
• Vernacular Press Act repealed
• Most liberal/popular Viceroy
rows.examPoints:
**'Father of Local Self-Govt'**

Factory Act 1881

Ilbert Bill controversy

Most liberal Viceroy

rows.name:
**Lord Curzon**

1899-1905
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• **Partition of Bengal (1905)** - sparked mass movement
• Universities Act (1904) - controlled education
• Indian Councils Act (1909) - during his time
• Police Commission (1902)
• Ancient Monuments Preservation Act (1904)
• Tibet Expedition (1904)
• Most controversial Viceroy
rows.examPoints:
**Bengal Partition (1905)**

Sparked Swadeshi Movement

Anti-national policies

Forced to resign

rows.name:
**Lord Minto II**

1905-1910
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• **Morley-Minto Reforms (1909)** - separate electorates
• Muslim League founded (1906) during his tenure
• Supported separate electorates for Muslims
• Repression of revolutionary terrorism
rows.examPoints:
**Morley-Minto Reforms 1909**

Separate electorates started

Muslim League formed

rows.name:
**Lord Hardinge**

1910-1916
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Delhi Durbar (1911) - capital shifted Delhi to Calcutta
• Bengal Partition annulled (1911)
• Delhi Conspiracy (1912) - bomb thrown at him
• WWI began during tenure (1914)
rows.examPoints:
**Capital shifted to Delhi**

Bengal Partition annulled

Bomb attack (1912)

rows.name:
**Lord Chelmsford**

1916-1921
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• **Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms (1919)** - Dyarchy
• Rowlatt Act (1919)
• Jallianwala Bagh Massacre (1919) during his tenure
• Non-Cooperation Movement launched (1920)
• Montagu Declaration (1917)
rows.examPoints:
**Montagu-Chelmsford Reforms**

Rowlatt Act & Jallianwala

Dyarchy introduced

rows.name:
**Lord Reading**

1921-1926
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Chauri Chaura (1922) - NCM suspended
• Gandhi arrested and tried (1922)
• Moplah Rebellion (1921)
• Prince of Wales visit (1921)
• Communist Party formed (1925)
rows.examPoints:
Gandhi's trial (1922)

Chauri Chaura during tenure

rows.name:
**Lord Irwin**

1926-1931
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Simon Commission (1927-30)
• Civil Disobedience Movement (1930)
• Dandi March (1930)
• **Gandhi-Irwin Pact (1931)**
• First Round Table Conference (1930)
• Bhagat Singh hanged (1931)
rows.examPoints:
**Gandhi-Irwin Pact (1931)**

Simon Commission period

Dandi March during tenure

rows.name:
**Lord Willingdon**

1931-1936
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Second CDM (1932) - crushed harshly
• Communal Award (1932)
• Poona Pact (1932)
• Government of India Act 1935 passed
• Severe repression of Congress
rows.examPoints:
Poona Pact (1932)

GOI Act 1935 passed

Harsh on Congress

rows.name:
**Lord Linlithgow**

1936-1944
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Provincial Elections (1937) - Congress ministries
• WWII declared (1939) - without consulting Indians
• Congress ministries resigned (1939)
• August Offer (1940)
• Pakistan Resolution (1940)
• Cripps Mission (1942)
• **Quit India Movement (1942)** - crushed brutally
• Bengal Famine (1943)
rows.examPoints:
**Longest tenure (8 years)**

WWII declared (1939)

Quit India crushed (1942)

rows.name:
**Lord Wavell**

1943-1947
rows.title: Viceroy
rows.majorEvents:
• Wavell Plan & Simla Conference (1945) - failed
• INA Trials (1945-46)
• Cabinet Mission (1946) - failed
• Interim Government formed (1946)
• Direct Action Day (1946) - Calcutta riots
• Failed to solve Hindu-Muslim problem
rows.examPoints:
Cabinet Mission (1946)

Interim Government

Failed to prevent partition

rows.name:
**Lord Mountbatten**

1947-1948
rows.title:
Last Viceroy

First GG of Independent India
rows.majorEvents:
• **Mountbatten Plan (June 3, 1947)** - Partition plan
• Indian Independence Act (July 18, 1947)
• **Independence & Partition (Aug 14-15, 1947)**
• Radcliffe Line - boundary drawn
• Integration of princely states
• Remained GG till June 1948 (C. Rajagopalachari succeeded)
rows.examPoints:
**Last Viceroy**

Mountbatten Plan (Jun 3)

Independence (Aug 15, 1947)

Partition executed

examTips.critical: **First GG**: Warren Hastings; **Last GG/First Viceroy**: Canning; **Last Viceroy**: Mountbatten
